snippet: The church made the disclosure about Joseph Smith to show transparency about its history at a time when some members have been feeling doubtful.
abstract: Mormon leaders acknowledge for the first time that Joseph Smith, church's founder and prophet, took as many as 40 wives, some already married and one only 14 years old; church's disclosure, in series of essays online, is part of effort to be transparent about its history at time when church members are increasingly encountering disturbing claims about the faith on the Internet.
lead_paragraph: The church made the disclosure about Joseph Smith to show transparency about its history at a time when some members have been feeling doubtful.

headline.print_headline: It’s Official: Mormon Founder Had Many Wives
